page.title: 20BEESTON REGIS GRAVEL PIT
page.content: The Carter Concrete gravel pit covers an area of 10 hectares, and quarries 70,000 tonnes of{gravel}per year. The plant costs Â£1 million per year to run, and employs 59 workers. It has 9 vehicles, a Â£500,000 Grading Plant, excavators and many machines for making various blocks or beams. Gravel is excavated from the huge face (which is 450 metres long and 25 metres high) and taken to the Grading Plant where it is washed and sorted into 5 sizes: 40mm+, 20mm+, 10mm+, 3mm+, and sand. It can then be despatched in 11 to 20 tonne loads. It is also used to make{concrete}items such as blocks and beams of all shapes and sizes, stairs, lamp-posts and lintels, which are delivered as far away as Hull, Grimsby and London. Sand and gravel, meanwhile, have a more local market.
